subject: Re: [junit] Re: Thinking of improving the auto generation of test cases
msgSnippet: Hi Jimm, ... I d suggest forgetting TDD in this context. Instead, talk about what you are doing: automatic test generation. If you take a look at Agitar s
messageBody:
Hi Jimm,

> I realise that there are many phases to TDD, but it seems what people
> have problems with is the idea of writing the tests before writing the
> code. With that in mind, I figured if i could help autogenerate some
> basic testing codes to get them off on a start, they could get the hang
> of it and probably improve on the tests generated later.

I'd suggest forgetting TDD in this context. Instead, talk about what
you are doing: automatic test generation. If you take a look at
Agitar's marketing material
(http://www.agitar.com/solutions/business/create_junit_tests.html),
they're not talking about TDD either--because automatic test
generation and TDD are simply two unrelated things.

Lasse
